newsitem.title: UK: UK Conservatives face 20-point gap-election poll.
newsitem.headline: UK Conservatives face 20-point gap-election poll.

text.p: The two latest opinion polls in Britain's election campaign showed the opposition Labour Party heading for a landslide victory on May 1 over the ruling Conservatives with a lead of more than 20 percentage points.

The latest Gallup snapshot poll of 1,000 voters for Friday's Daily Telegraph showed 52 percent favouring Labour. The Conservatives lagged behind on 31 percent and the centrist Liberal Democrats accounted for 11 percent.
Another month-long survey by Gallup of almost 8,000 voters put Labour support at 53.7 percent, the Conservatives at 29.8 percent and the Liberal Democrats at 10.8 percent.
